question: With which country India planned to conduct a joint head count of tigers?
explanation: Nepal and India will conduct a joint head count of tigers in the national parks, forests and sanctuaries in Nepal and those in India adjoining Nepal using the same camera tapping method. Cameras would be installed in various locations in the tiger habitats and their roaming areas. Images would be captured and animals' footsteps would be accessed. The counting starts from second week of November 2017.
